revision.text:
{{Infobox comedian | name = Pablo Francisco | image = | imagesize = 200 px | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = Pablo Francisco | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1974|01|04}} | birth_place = [[Tucson, Arizona]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Stand-up comedy|Stand-up]] | nationality = [[United States|American]] | active = 1994â€“present | genre = [[Impressionist (entertainment)|Impressions]], [[surreal humor]] | subject = [[Latin American culture]], [[everyday life]], [[movies]] | influences = [[Steve Martin]], [[Richard Pryor]], [[Benny Hill]] | notable_work = ''[[MADtv]]'' and
''[[Comedy Central Presents#Season 4 (2000-2001)|Comedy Central Presents]]'' | signature = | website = {{url|http://www.pablofrancisco.com}} }} '''Pablo Ridson Francisco''' (born January 4, 1974) is an [[United States|American]] [[stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]].{{cite news |last=Hawkins |first=Si |date=30 June 2008 |title=Five questions for . . . Pablo Francisco |url=http://metro.co.uk/2008/06/30/five-questions-for-pablo-francisco-226263/ |newspaper=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]] |location=London |access-date=23 August 2015}} He started his career doing [[Improvisational comedy|improv]] in [[Tempe, Arizona]]. ==Career== In the 1990s, he appeared on ''[[MADtv]]'' as a featured player. His stand-up act was introduced to America at large when he landed his own half-hour comedy special on ''[[Comedy Central Presents#Season 4 (2000-2001)|Comedy Central Presents]]'' in 2000. In 2001 and 2002, Francisco toured as part of "The Three Amigos" with [[Carlos Mencia]] and [[Freddy Soto]]. Since then, he has performed on ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'', [[VH1|VH1's]] ''ILL-ustrated'', ''[[Mind of Mencia]]'' as "The Voiceover Dude" (same as "Movie Voiceover Guy"), and most recently, ''[[Frank TV]]''. Francisco is recognized for vocal impressions of famous people including [[Jackie Chan]], [[Aaron Neville]], [[Arnold Schwarzenegger]], [[Howard Stern]], [[Casey Kasem]], [[Keanu Reeves]], [[Michael J. Fox]], [[Jerry Springer]], [[Don Lapre]], [[Celine Dion]], [[William Hung]], [[Danny Glover]], [[Gary Busey]], and most notably [[Don LaFontaine]] (the Movie Voiceover King). He also does sound effects and character voices like [[Count Dracula]] (as a Spanish Radio DeeJay), [[Droopy|Droopy Dog]], [[Chris Rock]], [[R2-D2]], [[Kermit the Frog]], [[Stone Cold Steve Austin]], [[Ozzy Osbourne]], [[Ricky Martin]], [[George Clooney]], [[Dennis Haysbert]], [[Anthony Sullivan (pitchman)|Anthony Sullivan]], [[Christopher Walken]], and [[Mr. Magoo]]. He also has a talent for [[beatboxing]]. Francisco tours in [[Southern California]]. In 2004, he performed for [[The Improv]] at the [[Irvine Spectrum Center]] is where his DVD ''Bits and Pieces'' was filmed, and his stand up material was used in Comedy Central's animated series [[Shorties Watchin' Shorties]]. On December 31, 2005, he hosted a [[New Years Eve]] party at the Irvine Improv. ==Television appearances== * ''MADtv'' * ''Make Me Laugh'' * ''The Tonight Show With Jay Leno'' * VH1's ''ILL-ustrated'' * ''Mind Of Mencia'' (as The Voiceover Dude) * ''Frank TV'' * ''Vakna Med The Voice'' (Swedish TV) * ''Just for Laughs Festival in Montreal'' * ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'' * ''[[The Tonight Show with Jay Leno]]'' * ''Tonight with Trevor Noah'' * ''Late Night with Jimmy Fallon'' * ''Gabriel Iglesias Presents Stand-Up Revolution'' * ''[[Comics Unleashed with Byron Allen]]'' ==Specials== * ''Knee to the Groin'' (Album) - 1998 * ''Sausage'' (Album) - 2000 * ''[[Comedy Central Presents]]'' - 2000 * ''The Three Amigos'' (with Carlos Mencia and Freddy Soto) - 2002 * ''Bits and Pieces'' - 2004, DVD * ''Ouch!'' - 2006, DVD * '' They Put It Out There'' - 2011, DVD ==References== ==External links== *[http://www.pablofrancisco.com Official website] *{{IMDb name|id=1096705}} *[http://www.myspace.com/pablofrancisco Pablo Francisco] at [[MySpace]] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Francisco, Pablo}} [[Category:1974 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American impressionists (entertainers)]] [[Category:American stand-up comedians]] [[Category:American people of Chilean descent]] [[Category:People from Tucson, Arizona]] [[Category:People from Casa Grande, Arizona]] [[Category:American sketch comedians]] [[Category:20th-century American comedians]] [[Category:21st-century American comedians]]
